content:
Diagnosis:	Transverse colon adenocarcinoma, pT2N0M0

Surgery:		Laparoscopic extended right hemicolectomy 15 March 2024

Histology:	Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma, MMR proficient, KRAS G13D mutation

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the colorectal oncology follow-up clinic. She has completed 3 months of adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy which finished on 12/6/24. She is recovering well with improving energy levels and has returned to work part-time. Her bowel function has normalized and she reports no ongoing symptoms. Her weight is stable at 68kg.

Her latest blood tests from 1/7/24 show normal CEA at 2.4 and stable liver function. We have arranged CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for September 2024 as per protocol. The plan is to continue regular 3-monthly follow-up with alternating clinical review and imaging for the first two years. I have provided written information about surveillance and symptoms to watch for. She will be reviewed again in clinic in October with her scan results.

cancer_timeline.value: Completed 3 months of adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy
CEA normal at 2.4 with stable liver function

patient_facts.value: No ongoing symptoms, normalized bowel function
Normal CEA 2.4 and stable liver function

status_updates.value: Stage II colon cancer post surgery and adjuvant chemotherapy. Recovering well with no current symptoms or concerns
Completed planned course of adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy
Review in October with scan results, continuing 3-monthly follow-up schedule
